com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.core
Class StateTransitionLatch

java.lang.Object
  com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.core.StateTransitionLatch
All Implemented Interfaces:
StateChangeListener, java.util.concurrent.Callable<State>
public class StateTransitionLatch
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.concurrent.Callable<State>, StateChangeListener

Implements a latch that waits for a state machine reach a specified state or optionally the error state. StateTransitionLatch instances are designed to be used with the JDK 1.5+ concurrency libraries as shown in the following sample of typical use. 


   StateTransitionLatch latch = myStateMachine.createStateTransitionLatch(mystate, true);
   Future result = exec.submit(latch);
   ...
   State finalState = result.get(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
   if (latch.isExpected())
   {
      // we found the expected state
   }

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Hodges

Parameters:

call

public State call()
Implements the latching logic, namely waiting until one of the following conditions is fulfilled:
  • We reach the desired state
  • We reach the error state (optional)
  • We are cancelled
We return the current state at the end of the run if and only if we find a desired state. Predicates like isExpected() allow clients to determine what we found.

Specified by:
call in interface java.util.concurrent.Callable<State>
Returns:
Current state if successful or null
